action.action-desc: Mrs. Dingell (for herself and Mr. Pallone) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend titles XIX and XXI of the Social Security Act to provide for 12-month continuous enrollment of individuals under the Medicaid program and Children’s Health Insurance Program.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Stabilize Medicaid and CHIP Coverage Act.

section.header: Providing for 12-month continuous enrollment of individuals under the Medicaid program and Children’s Health Insurance Program

subsection.text: Section 1902(e)(12) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396a(e)(12)), as amended by section 5112 of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2023, is further amended—

paragraph.text: in the header, by striking for children;
by striking who is under the age of 19 and;
in subparagraph (A), by adding or at the end;

subsection.text: 2107(e)(1)(K) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1397gg(e)(1)(K)), as amended by section 5112 of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2023, is further amended—

paragraph.text: by striking targeted low-income child and inserting individual; and
by striking child becomes and inserting individual becomes.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall take effect on the first day of the first fiscal quarter that begins on or after the date that is 1 year after the date of the enactment of this Act.
